Interface Rules

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Grid

    public interface Rules
    The interface has declared methods wihich represent rules for game of live

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int bottomLeftCorner(int i, int j, int counter)
      Counts how many neighbors of cell in bottom-left corner has
      int bottomRightCorner(int i, int j, int counter)
      Counts how many neighbors of cell in bottom-right corner has
      int column0(int i, int j, int counter)
      Counts how many neighbors of cell in column 0 has
      int lastColumn(int i, int j, int counter)
      Counts how many neighbors of cell in last column has
      int lastRow(int i, int j, int counter)
      Counts how many neighbors of cell in last row has
      int otherCells(int i, int j, int counter)
      Counts how many neighbors of cell for other cells has
      int row0(int i, int j, int counter)
      Counts how many neighbors of cell in row 0 has
      void rules(int i, int j, int counter)
      If alive cell has fewer than two live neighbors, the cell dies, if live cell has two or three live neighbors, the cell lives on to the next generation, if live cell has more than three live neighbors the cell dies, if dead cell has exactly three live neighbors, it becomes a live cell

      Counts how many neighbors of cell in top-left corner has

      • rules

        void rules(int i,
           int j,
           int counter)
        If alive cell has fewer than two live neighbors, the cell dies, if live cell has two or three live neighbors, the cell lives on to the next generation, if live cell has more than three live neighbors the cell dies, if dead cell has exactly three live neighbors, it becomes a live cell
        Parameters:
        i - row's number
        j - column number
        counter - counter of neighbours
